prompt: <description>Part 1 Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The prism is centered on a white background. Begin by creating a new coordinate system, with euler angles of -90 degrees on the X and Z axes and a translation vector of [0, 0, 0]. Draw the first face of the prism, which is a rectangle with vertices at [0, 0], [0.1071, 0], [0.1071, 0.0161], and [0, 0.0161]. This forms a closed loop and completes the face. Repeat this process for the following faces: Face 2: Loop with vertices at [0.0161, 0.7339], [0.0607, 0.7339], [0.0607, 0.75], [0.0161, 0.75]. Face 3: Loop with vertices at [0.4554, 0], [0.5446, 0], [0.5446, 0.0161], [0.5339, 0.0161], [0.4554, 0.0161]. Face 4: Loop with vertices at [0.5223, 0.7339], [0.5339, 0.7339], [0.5446, 0.7339], [0.567, 0.7339], [0.567, 0.75], [0.5223, 0.75]. Face 5: Loop with vertices at [0.5339, 0.0161], [0.5446, 0.0161], [0.5446, 0.7339], [0.5339, 0.7339]. Once the sketch is complete, scale the entire sketch by a factor of 0.75. Next, transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by extruding it along the normal by 0.7464 units. This will create the final shape of a rectangular prism with a curved top and a flat bottom. Part 2 Construct a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered middle section. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 1:2:3 in height, width, and depth respectively. The prism is centered in the image. Begin by creating a new coordinate system, with euler angles of 0 degrees on the X and Y axes and a translation vector of [0.0795, 0.5339, 0.6094]. Draw the first face of the prism, which is a rectangle with vertices at [0, 0], [0.5804, 0], [0.5804, 0.0804], and [0, 0.0804]. This forms a closed loop and completes the face. Extrude the sketch along the opposite direction of the normal by 0.0107 units, effectively cutting away a thin slice from the top of the prism. Once the sketch is complete and the extrusion is performed, this will create the final shape of a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered middle section. Final Shape The final shape of the CAD model is a rectangular prism with a flat bottom and a curved top. The curved top is created by Part 1, and the flat bottom is created by Part 2. Both parts contribute to the overall height of the model, which is given by the sum of the extrusion depths of Part 1 and Part 2. The width and length are determined by the bounding box of the final shape.</description>
